num_tested_probands: The proband was examined by experienced clinical geneticists who assessed their physical and mental status.
The number of individual probands for whom genetic testing was reported. Three probands were tested.
The text does not mention any probands being tested. It mentions that DNA was extracted from patients, two healthy siblings, and their parents, but it does not specify which individuals were tested.
The study tested 17 patients, but none of them are referred to as probands. Instead, they are described as having the disease.
The study analyzed 15 patients with mutations in aminoacyl-tRNA synthetases SARS and WARS2.
num_positive_het_probands: No heterozygous carrier (a relative of the proband) is mentioned in the report.
The number of probands who were heterozygous for a pathogenic variant. None of the three probands were found to be heterozygous carriers.
There is no mention of heterozygous carriers in the report.
There is no mention of heterozygous carriers in the report.
No patients had heterozygous mutations in the genes.
positive_phenotypes: The phenotype is not explicitly described in the report, but it is mentioned that the proband has moderate ID, microcephaly, ataxia, speech impairment, and aggressive behavior.
Clinical phenotypes associated with the positive probands. The only phenotype mentioned is SARS.

The text does not provide information on clinical phenotypes. However, it mentions that the study was conducted to investigate a specific syndrome (MCAHS) and that the authors analyzed the expression of a protein (SARS) in different human brain regions.
The shared phenotype mentioned in the title and throughout the report is 'Multiple Congenital Anomalies-Hypotonia-Seizures Syndrome'.
The patients had autosomal recessive intellectual disability.
num_compound_or_double_hets: No compound or double heterozygotes are reported in the study.
The number of individuals reported to have compound or double heterozygous mutations. None of the three probands were found to be compound or double heterozygotes.
There is no mention of compound or double heterozygotes in the report.
9 compound heterozygotes were identified in the PIGN cases, and 8 hemizygous PIGA mutations were found.
There were no compound or double heterozygotes among the patients.
Family 1-III:4, Family 1-III:10, Family: These family numbers refer to the probands' family relationships and are not directly related to compound or double heterozygous mutations.

Clinical_report_of_family_1.Family_history: The family has a history of intellectual disability (ID) in four out of nine children.
Clinical_report_of_family_1.Affected_children: Four affected children with ID, microcephaly, ataxia, and muscular weakness.
Clinical_report_of_family_1.Clinical_description: Moderate ID, speech impairment, aggressive behavior, microcephaly, ataxia, and muscular weakness.
Clinical_report_of_family_1.Genetic_test: DNA extracted from peripheral blood of patients (III:4, III:9, III:10, III:11), three healthy siblings, and their parents.

Clinical_report_of_family_2.Family_history: The family has a history of intellectual disability (ID) in three out of nine children.
Clinical_report_of_family_2.Affected_children: Three affected children with ID, athetosis, aggressive behavior, and speech impairment.
Clinical_report_of_family_2.Clinical_description: Moderate ID, athetosis, aggressive behavior, and speech impairment.
Clinical_report_of_family_2.Genetic_test: DNA extracted from peripheral blood of patients (V:6, V:7, V:8), their parents.

text: Compound heterozygous mutation in the WARS2 gene
